  system CPU at any time.
Pointer to the next operation to run after this operation is done
Absolute or relative start time (depending on the value of startTrigger)

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Identification of the trigger that starts the operation

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

Field.Description:
The main mode to use
0x00: BLE
0x01: IEEE 802.15.4
0x02: 2 Mbps GFSK
0x05: 5 Mbps coded 8-FSK
0xFF: Keep existing mode; update overrides only
Others: Reserved

LO divider setting to use. Supported values: 0, 2, 4,
  5, 6, 10, 12, 15, and 30.

BitField.BitDescription:
0x00: Differential mode
0x01: Single-ended mode RFP
0x02: Single-ended mode RFN
0x05 Single-ended mode RFP with external frontend control on RF pins (RFN and RXTX)
0x06 Single-ended mode RFN with external frontend control on RF pins (RFP and RXTX)
Others: Reserved

0: Internal bias
1: External bias

0x00: Write analog configuration.
Required first time after boot and when changing frequency band or front-end configuration
0x2D: Keep analog configuration.
May be used after standby or when changing mode with the same frequency band and front-end configuration
Others: Reserved

0: Power up frequency synth
1: Do not power up frequency synth

Field.Description: Configuration options
Transmit power

Pointer to a list of hardware and configuration registers to override. If NULL, no
  override is used.

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

Operation to perform
0: True if value == compareVal
1: True if value < compareVal
2: True if value > compareVal
3: Reserved

If 1, interchange the four bytes of the value, so that they are read
  most-significant-byte-first.
If 1, perform bit reversal of the value

0: Treat value and compareVal as unsigned
1–31: Treat value and compareVal as signed, where the value gives the number of the most significant bit in the signed number.

0: Use pValue as a pointer
1: Use pValue as a signed offset to the start of the last committed RX entry element

Field.Description: Options for comparison
Pointer to next operation if comparison result was true
Pointer to read from, or offset from last RX entry if patternOpt.bRxVal == 1
Bit mask to apply before comparison
Value to compare to

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...

Field.Description:
Channel to tune to in the start of the operation
0: Use existing channel
11–26: Use as IEEE 802.15.4 channel, i.e. frequency is (2405 + 5 × (channel - 11)) MHz
60–207: Frequency is (2300 + channel) MHz
Others: Reserved

BitField.BitDescription: If 1, automatically remove packets with CRC error from Rx queue
If 1, automatically remove packets that can be ignored according to frame filtering from Rx queue
If 1, include the received PHY header field in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, include the received CRC field in the stored packet; otherwise discard it
If 1, append an RSSI byte to the packet in the Rx queue
If 1, append a correlation value and CRC result byte to the packet in the Rx queue
If 1, append an index from the source matching algorithm
If 1, append a timestamp to the packet in the Rx queue

Field.Description: Pointer to receive queue
Pointer to output structure (NULL: Do not store results)

BitField.BitDescription:
0: Disable frame filtering
1: Enable frame filtering

0: Receive all packets to the end
1: Stop receiving frame once frame filtering has caused the frame to be rejected.

0: Disable auto ACK
1: Enable auto ACK.

0: Non-slotted ACK
1: Slotted ACK.

0: Auto-pend disabled
1: Auto-pend enabled
The value of the pending data bit in auto ACK packets that are not subject to auto-pend

0: Use auto-pend for any packet
1: Use auto-pend for data request packets only

0: Device is not PAN coordinator
1: Device is PAN coordinator
Reject frames where the frame version field in the FCF is greater than this value
Value to be AND-ed with the reserved part of the FCF; frame rejected if result is non-zero

Treatment of MSB of frame type field before frame-type filtering:
0: No modification
1: Invert MSB
2: Set MSB to 0
3: Set MSB to 1

0: Accept acknowledgement frames of any length >= 5
1: Accept only acknowledgement frames of length 5

Field.Description: Frame filtering options

BitField.BitDescription:
Treatment of frames with frame type 000 (beacon):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 001 (data):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 010 (ACK):
0: Reject, unless running ACK receive command
1: Always accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 011 (MAC command):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 100 (reserved):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 101 (reserved):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 110 (reserved):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Treatment of frames with frame type 111 (reserved):
0: Reject
1: Accept

Field.Description: Frame types to receive in frame filtering

BitField.BitDescription: Enable energy scan as CCA source
Enable correlator based carrier sense as CCA source
Enable sync found based carrier sense as CCA source

Operator to use between energy based and correlator based CCA
0: Report busy channel if either ccaEnergy or ccaCorr are busy
1: Report busy channel if both ccaEnergy and ccaCorr are busy

Operator to use between sync found based CCA and the others
0: Always report busy channel if ccaSync is busy
1: Always report idle channel if ccaSync is idle
Threshold for number of correlation peaks in correlator based carrier sense

Field.Description: CCA options
RSSI threshold for CCA
Number of extended address entries
Number of short address entries
Pointer to list of extended address entries
Pointer to list of short address entries
The extended address of the local device
The short address of the local device
The PAN ID of the local device

BitField.BitDescription: The initialization value for the CW parameter

0: non-slotted CSMA
1: slotted CSMA

0: RX stays on during CSMA backoffs
1: The CSMA-CA algorithm will suspend the receiver if no frame is being received
2: The CSMA-CA algorithm will suspend the receiver if no frame is being received, or after finishing it (including auto ACK) otherwise
3: The CSMA-CA algorithm will suspend the receiver immediately during back-offs

Field.Description: The NB parameter from the IEEE 802.15.4 CSMA-CA algorithm
The BE parameter from the IEEE 802.15.4 CSMA-CA algorithm
The number of remaining periods from a paused backoff countdown

  updated by the radio CPU during operation and may be read by the
  system CPU at any time.
Pointer to the next operation to run after this operation is done
Absolute or relative start time (depending on the value of startTrigger)

BitField.BitDescription: The type of trigger

0: No alternative trigger command
1: CMD_TRIGGER can be used as an alternative trigger
The trigger number of the CMD_TRIGGER command that triggers this action

0: A trigger in the past is never triggered, or for start of commands, give an error
1: A trigger in the past is triggered as soon as possible

Field.Description: Identification of the trigger that starts the operation

BitField.BitDescription: Condition for running next command: Rule for how to proceed
Number of skips + 1 if the rule involves skipping. 0: same, 1: next, 2: skip next, ...
